uk.ac.diamond.powder_toolkit.dataAnalysis

Interface IPowderIndexer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPowderIndexer, Ntreor

    public interface IPowderIndexer
    Interface designed to be a wrapper for indexing algorithms
    Author:
    sfz19839

    • Method Detail

      • getKeywords

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getKeywords()
        Returns:
        returns a map of keywords and values used in the indexing program

      • setKeywords

        void setKeywords(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> keywords)
        Parameters:
        keywords - Map set of keywords to be added to the indexing program

      • addKeyword

        void addKeyword(java.lang.String key,
              java.lang.String value)
        Adds keyowrds to the keyword map
        Parameters:
        key - of indexing program keywords
        value - a string usually in a numeric form the value of keyword key

      • getStandard_values

        java.lang.String[] getStandard_values()
        Returns:
        the standard values of the indexing programs keywords for example is x has a normal value 4 it will return 4

      • getKeys

        java.lang.String[] getKeys()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of standard keys

      • getFilepath

        java.lang.String getFilepath()
        Returns:
        the filepath used for creating a data file or running a data file

      • setFilepath

        void setFilepath(java.lang.String filepath)
        Parameters:
        filepath - sets the filepath used to create dat or run dat files

      • getData

        java.util.List<org.eclipse.dawnsci.analysis.api.dataset.IDataset> getData()
        Returns:
        returns the set of datasets used in the program

      • setData

        void setData(java.util.List<org.eclipse.dawnsci.analysis.api.dataset.IDataset> data)
        Parameters:
        data - the dataset used in the program usually just a single array with greater then 20 points

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        gets the title used to create the files

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(java.lang.String mytitle)
        Parameters:
        title - is the string used in file creation and in some programs operation

      • read_output

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> read_output()
        Returns:
        gets the clean output List of List of doubles that go a,b,c,alpha,beta,gamma all indexing programs should return something similar to this for cleaned output to work, future developer may consider changing this.

      • write_input

        void write_input()
        writes the input file, uses title file path and data

      • Run

        Run runs the indexing program
        Returns:
        a string list raw output
